clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Replacement Therapy Plus Extracorporeal Carbon Dioxide Removal
clinical_study.official_title: Combined Strategy of Renal Replacement Therapy Plus Extracorporeal Carbon Dioxide Removal in Patients With Acute Kidney Injury

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess whether in patients with acute kidney injury (AKI) requiring mechanical ventilation, a strategy that combines renal replacement therapy (RRT) and extracorporeal carbon dioxide removal (ECCO2R) allows reduction of tidal volume and plateau pressure. Systemic Inflammatory Response and Safety Variables will also be analysed.

primary_outcome.measure: Achievement of tidal volume reduction to 4 mL/kg while maintaining pH and PaCO2 to ± 20% of baseline values

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of inflammatory mediators release in plasma samples of patients
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma Concentrations of interleukin 6, interleukin 8, interleukin 1 beta, tumor necrosis factor alpha

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the changes in pH
Assessment of the changes in PaCO2
Assessment of the changes in PaO2

intervention.description: Patients with acute kidney injury will be treated with Renal replacement therapy associated to extracorporeal carbon dioxide removal in a single treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with acute kidney injury (AKI) requiring renal-replacement therapy and mechanical ventilation of duration ≥ 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- little chance of survival at 24 h (according to clinical judgment), pregnancy, mechanical ventilation with expected duration lower than 48h, age under 18 and over 90
